channel.title: MorningBrew as a feed
channel.description: This is a feed of recent MorningBrew articles published by Huginn

item.title: The Week Ahead: June 28
item.description: The biggest economic event of the week is the release of the June jobs report, which will tell us more about the improving labor market and whether inflation will show up in the form of higher wages.   Got any fun plans?
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: Key Performance Indicators: June 28
item.description: (Financial Times) Read: The tyranny of spreadsheets. That means scrapping traveler quarantines, daily case number announcements, and intensive contact tracing efforts.
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: Intellia Therapeutics Announces Big Gene Editing Breakthrough in Early-Phase Trials
item.description: For the first time, CRISPR technology has been used to successfully treat disease in vivo, or inside the human body. expect Intellia shares, which have gained 233% since its 2016 IPO, to pop today.  Looking ahead... And there’s not many moments in medicine where you get to experience that,” Intellia CEO John Leonard said.
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: Rescue Workers Continue to Search for Survivors of the Florida Condo Tower Collapse
item.description: Officials are now considering whether or not to temporarily evacuate the sister building, Champlain Towers North, which is located right next door and was built around the same time.
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: Extra Unemployment Benefits Are Drying Up
item.description: Businesses are desperate to hire workers, and many states think scrapping the extra $300/week in unemployment benefits, which the Biden administration incorporated into its pandemic relief bill, will spur more job-seeking.  In the states that cut off the extra payments the earliest, the number of workers who were paid benefits decreased 13.8% from mid-May to mid-June. On Capitol Hill last week, Fed Chair Jerome Powell said that extra benefits could be playing a role in the worker shortage problem, but focused his attention on other challenges holding back the job market.
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: Extra Unemployment Benefits Are Drying Up
item.description: In the states that cut off the extra payments the earliest, the number of workers who were paid benefits decreased 13.8% from mid-May to the week ending June 12. Businesses are desperate to hire workers, and many states think scrapping the extra $300/week in unemployment benefits, which the Biden administration incorporated into its pandemic relief bill, will spur more job-seeking. Ten more states including Florida, Ohio, and Texas ended extra unemployment benefits on Saturday. Earlier this month, the job site Indeed found that job search activity fell below the national trend in states that cut off extra benefits in June.
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: Rescue Workers Continue to Search for Survivors of the Florida Condo Tower Collapse
item.description: Officials are now considering whether or not to temporarily evacuate the sister building, Champlain Towers North, which is located right next door and was built around the same time.

item.title: Make it Work: First Job out of College
item.description: —Kimo            How exciting! Maintaining a relationship with someone who's been there, done that can help you avoid making preventable mistakes and boost your learning curve exponentially.
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: F1 Is Having a Moment in the United States
item.description: Last week, Formula 1 re-upped its partnership with the sports merchandise retailer Fanatics after sales on the online F1 store popped 40% globally in 2020. F101: A Formula 1 season typically consists of 20+-races in glamorous locations like Monaco, Abu Dhabi, and Portugal. It's got that kind of power," he told The Drive about the new F1 race. F1 has added a race there for the 2022 season, which—along with Austin—makes for two races held in the US on the same calendar. And I think it's going to be something that redefines who we are. The Brew's Formula 1 Slack channel is the fastest-growing micro-community at the company.  But Formula 1 has been around since 1950. I think this is one of those macro events, like Art Basel. They actually change the city.
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: Icebreakers with… Chef José Andrés
item.description: It's the people of India coming together to heal and feed the people of India—it's really amazing. Can you tell us about your experience there? Back home, do you see #ChefsforAmerica winding down as we move out of the pandemic, or continuing in some other form? You and WCK recently spent some time in India serving meals to frontline workers. There are six days left to donate to Morning Brew's fundraiser for World Central Kitchen and secure a copy of our digital cookbook, Brunch with the Brew. You'll just have to follow me on TikTok for the best ones…maybe you can start with making cocktails in the snow. There are so many! You only get to eat one condiment for the rest of your life. They don't need to go stand in line for hours, and instead can pick up a meal from a restaurant or get it delivered, which hopefully makes it a little easier for families to get through the day.
item.author: Alex Hickey

item.title: Money Matters: Is a Financial Advisor Worth It?
item.description: Is it worth getting a financial advisor, and if so, how do I choose one? For example, consider a one-time financial review. Financial advisors look at your financial situation, get a feel for your goals, and make and manage a personalized investing plan.
item.author: Ryan Lasker

item.title: Key Performance Indicators: June 26
item.description: (Bicycling) Next up, he’s planning to launch a weekly variety show on HBO Max.Read: In honor of the Tour de France beginning today, check out the epic saga of Primož Roglič.
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: Virgin Galactic Receives FAA Clearance to Take Passengers to Space
item.description: Billionaire Sir Richard Branson’s space travel company Virgin Galactic received FAA clearance yesterday to fly paying customers to space—great news for the 600 people on its waitlist eager to glimpse the curvature of Earth from 56 miles up. Zoom out: Developments in space travel, specifically space tourism, are moving at lightning speed.
item.author: Matty Merritt

item.title: Springsteen Plays to a Full Audience in Big Moment for Broadway
item.description: Fun fact: The captain of the $1 billion ship, Kate McCue, was the first American woman to captain a cruise ship in 2015. At least 95% of the passengers are vaccinated against Covid-19, operator Celebrity Cruises said, and the ship will sail at 35% capacity.
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: Consumer Spending Buoyed By Shoppers Updating Their Wardrobes
item.description: Everyone’s feeling optimistic about retail this summer: Consumer spending on goods in May was 20% higher than in February 2020, a government report showed yesterday, and overall consumer spending (including services, which are starting to trend upward, too) is estimated to grow 9% this year—the fastest rate since 1946, per Oxford Economics. Nike predicted it’ll pass $50 billion in revenue this fiscal year for the first time thanks in part to a rapidly growing e-commerce biz. Looking ahead...
item.author: Jamie Wilde

item.title: Key Performance Indicators: June 26
item.description: It’s not easy to do, but try—try and do what you love with people you love. It’s not easy to do. (Bicycling) Next up, he’s planning to launch a weekly variety show on HBO Max.Read: In honor of the Tour de France beginning today, check out the epic saga of Primož Roglič.

item.title: Consumer Spending Buoyed By Shoppers Updating Their Wardrobes
item.description: Nike predicted it’ll pass $50 billion in revenue this fiscal year for the first time thanks in part to a rapidly growing e-commerce biz. increased consumer spending sets the economy up for a strong summertime shopping season, as retailers race to open stores back up, hire elusive workers, and smooth out supply chain kinks to meet demand. Looking ahead...  A Harris Poll survey found that 61% of US adults’ weight fluctuated in the past year, with an average weight gain of 29 pounds among those that put on, rather than lost, weight.
item.author: Jamie Wilde

item.title: Key Performance Indicators: June 25
item.description: (Rolling Stone) Then he went too far. Read: David Dobrik was the king of YouTube. He told the AP he expects the pet business to keep booming as people move into larger, suburban houses and workplaces become more pet-friendly.
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: BuzzFeed's Got a SPAC That Values the Media Company at $1.5 Billion
item.description: BuzzFeed hopes to scoop up more media companies and use that muscle to grab market share from the most powerful throuple in digital ads: Google, Facebook, and Amazon, which accounted for almost 90% of the US digital ad market in 2020, per ad agency GroupM. Now, BuzzFeed is in growth mode.
item.author: Matty Merritt

item.title: President Biden, Group of Bipartisan Senators Reach an Infrastructure Deal
item.description: Some spending on child and elder care as well as education was cut from Biden's original plan.   don't start daydreaming about good train wi-fi yet, the plan still has a ways to go to become law. Looking ahead...  A corporate tax rate increase to fund the plan, which Biden originally proposed, was also ditched.
item.author: Matty Merritt

item.title: Microsoft Hits $2T Market Cap, Shows off Major Windows Update
item.description: . Microsoft was incorporated 40 years ago today, but instead of installing a barn door in its master bathroom, the company closed above a $2 trillion market cap for the first time this week and unveiled its first major Windows update in years.    Six bills that could reshape antitrust law in the US cleared a major hurdle yesterday morning. until now?
item.author: Alex Hickey

item.title: President Biden, Group of Bipartisan Senators Reach an Infrastructure Deal
item.description: House Speaker Nancy Pelosi said her chamber would only take up the infrastructure plan if Democrats were able to push through a separate spending package. don't start daydreaming about good train wi-fi yet, because the plan still has a ways to go to become law. Looking ahead...
item.author: Matty Merritt

item.title: Resorts World Opens in Las Vegas
item.description: Big picture: Las Vegas is firmly in a post-Covid mentality right now, bringing visitors back to its business conventions and entertainment options. large:With a price tag of $4.3 billion, Resorts World is the most expensive property ever developed in the city.
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: Key Performance Indicators: June 24
item.description: (Medium)  Read: Why didn’t bullet journaling work for me? Buffett has pledged to give away about 99% of his net worth.
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: Britney Spears Asks Judge to End Her Conservatorship in Public Testimony
item.description: In her most public statement to date about her personal affairs, Britney Spears told an LA probate judge that she wants to end the conservatorship she's been under for 13 years." Big picture: Spears’s story gained traction after her fans started the #FreeBritney movement in 2019.
item.author: Matty Merritt

item.title: Hong Kong’s Largest Pro-Democracy Paper Shuts Down
item.description: the former chair of the Hong Kong Journalists Association said, “Police did not rule out the possibility of more arrests, and the next [target] could be other media.”  Radio Television Hong Kong (RTHK) was forced to swap its station head with a career politician with no journalism experience.
item.author: Jamie Wilde

item.title: Supreme Court Hands Down Major Rulings on Farms, Free Speech, and Fannie and Freddie
item.description: Yesterday, the Supreme Court struck down a regulation that allowed union organizers to meet with agricultural workers during some periods of the day. The Supreme Court didn’t buy that, but did concede that the structure of the agency that oversees Fannie and Freddie is unconstitutional.  Bottom line: Because Levy didn’t bully anyone or post her frustrations during school, SCOTUS said she had the right to be an angry teen. The school banned Levy from cheer for a full year and her (clearly cool) dad got the ACLU involved, claiming that the school violated her First Amendment rights.
item.author: Jamie Wilde

item.title: Britney Spears Asks Judge to End Her Conservatorship in Public Testimony
item.description: Yesterday, Britney Spears gave a public statement to an LA County Superior Court about her 13-year conservatorship, the first time she’s spoken publicly since 2019. . Spears’s story is one filled with speculation, but yesterday’s statement was the first time she publicly spoke against the conservatorship and her father.
item.author: Matty Merritt
